channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Simultaneous Multiple Object Detection and Pose Estimation using 3D Model Infusion with Monocular Vision
item.description: Using the labeling method, we provide the KITTI-6DoF dataset with $\sim7. 5$K annotated frames.

item.title: Diffusion Denoising Process for Perceptron Bias in Out-of-distribution Detection
item.description: Under this assumption, we design new detection methods and indicator scores.

item.title: Neural network based generation of 1-dimensional stochastic fields with turbulent velocity statistics
item.description: We define and study a fully-convolutional neural network stochastic model, NN-Turb, which generates 1-dimensional fields with turbulent velocity statistics.

item.title: Mutually-Regularized Dual Collaborative Variational Auto-encoder for Recommendation Systems
item.description: However, since latent item variables are not modeled in UAE, it is difficult to utilize the widely available item content information when ratings are sparse.

item.title: Multitask Vision-Language Prompt Tuning
item.description: Specifically, (i) we demonstrate the effectiveness of learning a single transferable prompt from multiple source tasks to initialize the prompt for each target task; (ii) we show many target tasks can benefit each other from sharing prompt vectors and thus can be jointly learned via multitask prompt tuning.

item.title: Enhancing Crisis-Related Tweet Classification with Entity-Masked Language Modeling and Multi-Task Learning
item.description: Social media has become an important information source for crisis management and provides quick access to ongoing developments and critical information.

item.title: FlowLens: Seeing Beyond the FoV via Flow-guided Clip-Recurrent Transformer
item.description: Limited by hardware cost and system size, camera's Field-of-View (FoV) is not always satisfactory.

item.title: Normalizing Flow with Variational Latent Representation
item.description: The resulting method is significantly more powerful than the standard normalization flow approach for generating data distributions with multiple modes.

item.title: TinyQMIX: Distributed Access Control for mMTC via Multi-agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Therefore, the trained agents are able to quickly adapt to dynamic traffic and provide low access delay.

item.title: Diffusion-Based Scene Graph to Image Generation with Masked Contrastive Pre-Training
item.description: Generating images from graph-structured inputs, such as scene graphs, is uniquely challenging due to the difficulty of aligning nodes and connections in graphs with objects and their relations in images.

item.title: Neural networks trained with SGD learn distributions of increasing complexity
item.description: The ability of deep neural networks to generalise well even when they interpolate their training data has been explained using various "simplicity biases".

item.title: Contrastive Masked Autoencoders for Self-Supervised Video Hashing
item.description: To capture video semantic information for better hashing learning, we adopt an encoder-decoder structure to reconstruct the video from its temporal-masked frames.

item.title: PointCLIP V2: Adapting CLIP for Powerful 3D Open-world Learning
item.description: Contrastive Language-Image Pre-training (CLIP) has shown promising open-world performance on 2D image tasks, while its transferred capacity on 3D point clouds, i. e., PointCLIP, is still far from satisfactory.

item.title: Bursting the Burden Bubble? An Assessment of Sharma et al.'s Counterfactual-based Fairness Metric
item.description: Metrics are needed to evaluate the fairness of a model.

item.title: Mean Shift Mask Transformer for Unseen Object Instance Segmentation
item.description: To illustrate the effectiveness of our method, we apply MSMFormer to Unseen Object Instance Segmentation, which yields a new state-of-the-art of 87. 3 Boundary F-meansure on the real-world Object Clutter Indoor Dataset (OCID).

item.title: Motor Imagery Decoding Using Ensemble Curriculum Learning and Collaborative Training
item.description: The first loss applies curriculum learning, forcing each feature extractor to specialize to a subset of the training subjects and promoting feature diversity.

item.title: Plug and Play Active Learning for Object Detection
item.description: We hypothesise that this is because: (1) it is difficult to quantify uncertainty for object detection as it consists of both localisation and classification, where some classes are harder to localise, and others are harder to classify; (2) it is difficult to measure similarities for diversity-based AL when images contain different numbers of objects.

item.title: Recovering Fine Details for Neural Implicit Surface Reconstruction
item.description: Recent works on implicit neural representations have made significant strides.

item.title: Instance-specific and Model-adaptive Supervision for Semi-supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Relying on the model's performance, iMAS employs a class-weighted symmetric intersection-over-union to evaluate quantitative hardness of each unlabeled instance and supervises the training on unlabeled data in a model-adaptive manner.

item.title: RAILD: Towards Leveraging Relation Features for Inductive Link Prediction In Knowledge Graphs
item.description: In this work, a novel Relation Aware Inductive Link preDiction (RAILD) is proposed for KG completion which learns representations for both unseen entities and unseen relations.

item.title: Challenges and Applications of Automated Extraction of Socio-political Events from Text (CASE 2022): Workshop and Shared Task Report
item.description: We provide a summary of the fifth edition of the CASE workshop that is held in the scope of EMNLP 2022.

item.title: Semantic Segmentation for Fully Automated Macrofouling Analysis on Coatings after Field Exposure
item.description: Biofouling is a major challenge for sustainable shipping, filter membranes, heat exchangers, and medical devices.

item.title: Perceiver-VL: Efficient Vision-and-Language Modeling with Iterative Latent Attention
item.description: We present Perceiver-VL, a vision-and-language framework that efficiently handles high-dimensional multimodal inputs such as long videos and text.

item.title: Spatiotemporal Modeling of Multivariate Signals With Graph Neural Networks and Structured State Space Models
item.description: Multivariate signals are prevalent in various domains, such as healthcare, transportation systems, and space sciences.

item.title: Expectation-Maximization Contrastive Learning for Compact Video-and-Language Representations
item.description: Most video-and-language representation learning approaches employ contrastive learning, e. g., CLIP, to project the video and text features into a common latent space according to the semantic similarities of text-video pairs.

item.title: RobustLoc: Robust Camera Pose Regression in Challenging Driving Environments
item.description: Experiments demonstrate that RobustLoc surpasses current state-of-the-art camera pose regression models and achieves robust performance in various environments.

item.title: UniMSE: Towards Unified Multimodal Sentiment Analysis and Emotion Recognition
item.description: Multimodal sentiment analysis (MSA) and emotion recognition in conversation (ERC) are key research topics for computers to understand human behaviors.

item.title: Are All Combinations Equal? Combining Textual and Visual Features with Multiple Space Learning for Text-Based Video Retrieval
item.description: In this paper we tackle the cross-modal video retrieval problem and, more specifically, we focus on text-to-video retrieval.

item.title: Segmentation, Classification, and Quality Assessment of UW-OCTA Images for the Diagnosis of Diabetic Retinopathy
item.description: Diabetic Retinopathy (DR) is a severe complication of diabetes that can cause blindness.

item.title: Exploring the Efficacy of Pre-trained Checkpoints in Text-to-Music Generation Task
item.description: Benefiting from large-scale datasets and pre-trained models, the field of generative models has recently gained significant momentum.

item.title: Directed Acyclic Graph Factorization Machines for CTR Prediction via Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Some recent knowledge distillation based methods transfer knowledge from complex teacher models to shallow student models for accelerating the online model inference.

item.title: Efficient Generalization Improvement Guided by Random Weight Perturbation
item.description: To fully uncover the great potential of deep neural networks (DNNs), various learning algorithms have been developed to improve the model's generalization ability.

item.title: Blind Knowledge Distillation for Robust Image Classification
item.description: We introduce Blind Knowledge Distillation - a novel teacher-student approach for learning with noisy labels by masking the ground truth related teacher output to filter out potentially corrupted knowledge and to estimate the tipping point from generalizing to overfitting.

item.title: Place Recognition under Occlusion and Changing Appearance via Disentangled Representations
item.description: Place recognition is a critical and challenging task for mobile robots, aiming to retrieve an image captured at the same place as a query image from a database.

item.title: Novel transfer learning schemes based on Siamese networks and synthetic data
item.description: We make the data sets available at https://pub. uni-bielefeld. de/record/2960030.

item.title: Last-Mile Embodied Visual Navigation
item.description: Realistic long-horizon tasks like image-goal navigation involve exploratory and exploitative phases.

item.title: Cross-Modal Contrastive Learning for Robust Reasoning in VQA
item.description: For each positive pair, we regard the images from different graphs as negative samples and deduct the version of multi-positive contrastive learning.

item.title: Exhaustive Symbolic Regression
item.description: To address these issues we introduce a new method for SR -- Exhaustive Symbolic Regression (ESR) -- which systematically and efficiently considers all possible equations and is therefore guaranteed to find not only the true optimum but also a complete function ranking.

item.title: Orientation recognition and correction of Cardiac MRI with deep neural network
item.description: In this paper, the problem of orientation correction in cardiac MRI images is investigated and a framework for orientation recognition via deep neural networks is proposed.

item.title: PS-Transformer: Learning Sparse Photometric Stereo Network using Self-Attention Mechanism
item.description: While they are effective with the dense capture, simple first-order operations often fail to capture the high-order interactions among observations under small number of different lights.

item.title: A Simple Parametric Classification Baseline for Generalized Category Discovery
item.description: Recent works in GCD argue that a non-parametric classifier formed using semi-supervised $k$-means can outperform strong baselines which use parametric classifiers as it can alleviate the over-fitting to seen categories in the labelled set.

item.title: Understanding and Improving Visual Prompting: A Label-Mapping Perspective
item.description: As highlighted below, we show that when reprogramming an ImageNet-pretrained ResNet-18 to 13 target tasks, our method outperforms baselines by a substantial margin, e. g., 7. 9% and 6. 7% accuracy improvements in transfer learning to the target Flowers102 and CIFAR100 datasets.

item.title: Discrete Lagrangian Neural Networks with Automatic Symmetry Discovery
item.description: By one of the most fundamental principles in physics, a dynamical system will exhibit those motions which extremise an action functional.

item.title: Heterogenous Ensemble of Models for Molecular Property Prediction
item.description: Previous works have demonstrated the importance of considering different modalities on molecules, each of which provide a varied granularity of information for downstream property prediction tasks.

item.title: Can Single-Pass Contrastive Learning Work for Both Homophilic and Heterophilic Graph?
item.description: To answer this, we analyze the concentration property of features obtained by neighborhood aggregation on both homophilic and heterophilic graphs, introduce the single-pass graph contrastive learning loss based on the property, and provide performance guarantees of the minimizer of the loss on downstream tasks.

item.title: VER: Learning Natural Language Representations for Verbalizing Entities and Relations
item.description: Entities and relationships between entities are vital in the real world.

item.title: Spectral Adversarial Training for Robust Graph Neural Network
item.description: In this work, we seek to address these challenges and propose Spectral Adversarial Training (SAT), a simple yet effective adversarial training approach for GNNs.

item.title: UniMASK: Unified Inference in Sequential Decision Problems
item.description: Randomly masking and predicting word tokens has been a successful approach in pre-training language models for a variety of downstream tasks.

item.title: Joint Embedding Predictive Architectures Focus on Slow Features
item.description: Many common methods for learning a world model for pixel-based environments use generative architectures trained with pixel-level reconstruction objectives.

item.title: Modeling Fine-grained Information via Knowledge-aware Hierarchical Graph for Zero-shot Entity Retrieval
item.description: We extract the knowledge units from the corresponding context and then construct a mention/entity centralized graph.
